result.execSummary:
The defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to count 2 but concurrent with sentences in case #20CM2232; with credit for 81 days time served; Court granted Huber privileges for work and treatment

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court waived the DNA surcharge as to this case due to a finding of indigency. Court ordered the defendant to pay all other court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DV surcharges) by the end of supervision. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.

- Mental Health Evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment.
- Batterers Intervention Program.
- Parenting Class.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- NO CONTACT with C.A., (Third Party Contact upon Agent's approval).

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo

records.addlTxt:
CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 40 FOR BRANCH 29. 
Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing.  Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Count 2 but CONCURRENT to sentences in case #20CM2232, with credit for 81 days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and treatment.  

AS TO COUNT 2: 
The Court sentenced the defendant to 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, CONSECUTIVE to Count 1 but CONCURRENT to sentences in case #20CM2232. The Court granted Huber privileges for work and treatment.  

AS TO BOTH COUNTS: 
The Court STAYED these sentences and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers. 
- Provide DNA sample.
- Mental health evaluation and follow through with any recommended treatment. 
- Pay DV surcharge as to both counts. 
- Batterer's intervention program. 
- Parenting class. 
- No contact with C.A. (third party contact upon agent's approval).
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 

Court leaves restitution open at this time.  Court waived the DNA surcharge as to this case due to a finding of indigency. Court ordered the defendant to pay all other court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DV surcharges) by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. 

20 day appeal rights given.  Firearm warning given.  Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 29.
Restitution hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Case set for a sentencing hearing. Branch 29 is in trial and unable to hear the matter. Case spun to Branch 40, Judge Shelton in room 634 Courthouse. Parties notified.
Received and filed. Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights/ Addendum

Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Jury Trial. 

Defense counsel advises that there has been a change in circumstances and the parties are now in a resolution posture. 

Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

Pursuant to negotiations and on the Motion of the State, Court Ordered Counts 3, 4, and 5 DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.

As to Counts 1 and 2: Defendant changes pleas to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's pleas.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Case adjourned to Branch 29 for Sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel is unavailable to complete a plea hearing. Case remains calendared as previously set in Branch 29.

Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a final pre-trial. Defense counsel requests a plea hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Expires: 11/8/22.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo not in court, in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Status conference held.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring. GPS OVERRIDE for victim and community safety.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $5,500.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  24 hour curfew with the exception of verified employment, court and legal appointments.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CA (7/19/88)

Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Martin David Vilchis-Jacabo appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
